pairs.subject: Quarterly Performance Review
pairs.desc:
Dear Team,

As we approach the end of the quarter, I wanted to remind everyone about the upcoming performance reviews. Please find attached the performance report that outlines key metrics and areas for improvement. Make sure to review it thoroughly before your one-on-one meetings.

Best,
HR Team
pairs.explain: The email comes from the HR department and contains a legitimate attachment related to performance review.

pairs.subject: Urgent: Update Your Payroll Information
pairs.desc:
Attention Employee,

We have noticed some discrepancies in your payroll information. Please download the attached form, fill it out, and return it to us as soon as possible to avoid any delays in your next paycheck.

Thank you,
Payroll Department
pairs.explain: The email requests sensitive information and includes an executable attachment, which is a common phishing tactic.

pairs.subject: New IT Security Protocols
pairs.desc:
Hello Team,

As part of our ongoing efforts to enhance security, we have implemented new IT protocols. Attached is a document outlining these changes and what you need to do to comply. Please read it carefully and reach out if you have questions.

Best,
IT Department
pairs.explain: The email is from the IT department with a relevant attachment discussing security protocols.

pairs.subject: Immediate Action Required: Account Verification
pairs.desc:
Dear User,

We need you to verify your account immediately to prevent suspension. Please download the attached verification form and follow the instructions. Failure to do so will result in account restrictions.

Regards,
Support Team
pairs.explain: The email creates a sense of urgency and contains an executable attachment, which is indicative of phishing.

pairs.subject: Travel Itinerary Confirmation
pairs.desc:
Hi,

Your travel itinerary has been confirmed for the upcoming conference. Please find the attached document for all details regarding flights and accommodations. Let us know if you have any questions.

Safe travels,
Travel Team
pairs.explain: The email is from the travel department and includes a standard itinerary attachment.

pairs.subject: Invoice Due: Immediate Payment Required
pairs.desc:
Dear Employee,

This is a reminder that your invoice is overdue. Please find the attached invoice and make payment immediately to avoid penalties. If you have already paid, please disregard this message.

Thank you,
Billing Department
pairs.explain: The email pressures the recipient to act quickly and contains an executable attachment, which is a red flag.

pairs.subject: Annual Compliance Training Reminder
pairs.desc:
Dear Team,

This is a friendly reminder that the annual compliance training is coming up next month. Attached is the schedule for the training sessions. Please ensure you attend the session assigned to your department.

Best,
Compliance Team
pairs.explain: The email is from the compliance department with a relevant training schedule attached.

pairs.subject: Security Alert: Account Access Attempt
pairs.desc:
Attention,

We detected an unauthorized access attempt on your account. Please review the attached details and follow the instructions to secure your account immediately.

Regards,
Security Team
pairs.explain: The email instills fear and includes an executable attachment, which is a common phishing tactic.

pairs.subject: New Policy Changes Effective Next Month
pairs.desc:
Dear Employees,

We want to inform you about some important policy changes that will take effect next month. Please review the attached document for full details. It is crucial that everyone understands these changes.

Thank you,
Legal Department
pairs.explain: The email is from the legal department and contains a legitimate document regarding policy changes.

pairs.subject: Your Account Has Been Compromised
pairs.desc:
Dear User,

We have detected suspicious activity on your account. Please download the attached alert and follow the steps to secure your account immediately. Failing to do so may result in permanent loss of access.

Sincerely,
Alert Team
pairs.explain: The email creates urgency and includes an executable attachment, which indicates phishing.
